Joette Smith was found slain in Santa Cruz County river in 1983. DNA helped solve mystery

The killing in 1983 rattled the small town of Ben Lomond, a community just a few miles north of Felton. Sheriff’s deputies found Smith — the 33-year-old owner of a well-known restaurant in town called Buffalo Gals — floating dead in the river and ruled the death a homicide.

A second former San Francisco high school student has accused her school’s athletic director of sexually abusing her on campus, as new records obtained by The Chronicle show the school district was moving to fire Lawrence Young-Yet Chan — but instead allowed him to resign.
